repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Employment Services
            and Social Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely, with substantial
            institutional development impacts. Key lessons address: 1)
            general aspects on design, which particularly in transition
            economies, should focus on realistic project objectives; on
            the need for monitoring indicators to measure effectiveness;
            on monitoring real policy development; and, on careful
            consideration of regional partnerships, particularly under
            fiscal constraints, to define adequate investment levels; 2)
            employment aspects, calling for a revision to the legal
            framework in order to address labor relations, and the
            provision of employment services; and, for a properly
            administered replication system, mainly through significant
            will, and complementary infrastructure for staff
            development; 3) social aspects, specifically on the balance
            of investments, identifying the need to go beyond benefit
            administration, and statistical analysis, in an attempt to
            optimize social protection policy, and modernize
            institutional arrangements, to include resource planning; on
            information technology processes, procedures, and
            procurement, to achieve uniformity, define the needs to be
            supported by technical staffs, and, strengthen procurement
            requirements; and, 4) project management aspects,
            particularly the need for a strong project unit to
            coordinate information exchange, financing and payment of
            taxes, and, decentralization of customs clearance.

5082230.trustfund:
TF033687-RUSSIA - EDUCATION,TF033626-RUSSIA - EMPLOYMENT SERVICES
            AND SOCIAL PROTECTION,TF031238-RUSSIA - COMMUNITY SUPPORT,TF028511-LABOR/SOCIAL - RUSSIA

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Employment Services
            and Social Protection Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of this project
            is to quickly develop the capacity of the Federal Employment
            Service (FES) to process the anticipated upsurge of benefit
            claims from the rapidly growing numbers of unemployed.  It
            is also aimed at developing the capacity of the FES to carry
            out active employment policies, including retraining, at
            assisting the Ministry of Social Protection (MSP) develop
            improved pensions administration; to reform the pension
            system and commence the design of a modern social security
            system. The loan will finance equipment and technical
            assistance:  (a) to rapidly improve the FES's capacity
            to register and pay benefits to the unemployed, and to
            introduce computer systems, policies, standards and related
            software; (b) to build the longer term capacity of the FES
            and the MSP: (i) for the FES: to design programs; to
            strengthen program services; to strengthen FES's
            efforts to organize job training for the unemployed; (ii)
            for the MSP: to improve the operational effectiveness of the
            MSP and develop and test the automation of cash benefit
            delivery; and (iii) to initiate the design of a modern
            social security scheme and the development of a master plan
            for the different agencies involved with employment service,
            cash benefits and social assistance, together with
            recommendations for phasing and a detailed design for the
            next phase.
